lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/toki.Toki.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run toki.Toki.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
// Update the title above to match the actual product name
// Describe the action and its outcome.
// A description of the expected outcome goes here
* Parses raw user input into executable {@link toki.command.Command} objects.
* Performs tokenization/validation of arguments and constructs the appropriate command
* (e.g., {@code todo}, {@code deadline}, {@code event}, {@code list}, {@code mark}, etc.).
private static LocalDate parseDate(String s) throws TokiException {
throw new TokiException("Use date format yyyy-MM-dd.");
* Parses a raw input line into a {@link toki.command.Command}.
* @throws TokiException if the input is invalid or incomplete
public static Command parse(String full) throws TokiException {
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: deadline <desc>");
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: deadline <desc> /by yyyy-MM-dd");
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: event <desc> /from yyyy-MM-dd /to yyyy-MM-dd");
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: mark <index>");
throw new TokiException("Index must be positive.");
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: unmark <index>");
throw new TokiException("Index must be positive.");
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: delete <index>");
throw new TokiException("Index must be positive.");
throw new TokiException("Format of the Command is: find <text>");
default: throw new TokiException("This is an unknown command.");
* Handles persistence of tasks to and from disk.
* Reads tasks from the save file on startup and writes the current {@link TaskList}
* after mutating commands. The storage format is a simple line-based representation.
//deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
* Saves the given tasks to the backing file.
* @throws TokiException if writing to disk fails
public void save(List<Task> tasks) throws TokiException {
throw new TokiException("Could not save tasks to file: " + path);
* Loads tasks from the backing file.
* @return a {@code List<Task>} containing all persisted tasks
* @throws TokiException if the file is missing or malformed
throw new TokiException("Could not load tasks from file: " + path);
* Converts a single line of text from the save file into a {@link Task} object.
* The line is expected to be in the format:
* where {@code done} is {@code "1"} for completed tasks or {@code "0"} otherwise.
* @param line the raw line from the data file
* @return the corresponding {@link Task}, or {@code null} if the type tag is unrecognised
* Serializes a {@link Task} object into its line representation for storage.
* The returned string uses the same pipe-delimited format expected by
* where {@code done} is {@code "1"} if the task is completed or {@code "0"} otherwise.
* @return the string representation to be written into the data file
return String.join(" | ", "E", done, e.getDescription(), e.getFrom().toString(), e.getTo().toString());
* Entry point of the Toki application.
* Wires together the {@link Storage}, {@link Ui}, {@link Parser}, and {@link TaskList},
* loads previously saved tasks (if any), and runs the read–eval–print loop that
* accepts user commands and executes them until exit.
/** Deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks to the file. */
/** The in-memory task list containing all user tasks. */
/** Handles interactions with the user (input and output). */
* Constructs a new {@code Toki} application instance.
* Loads tasks from the given file path (if available). If loading fails,
* initializes an empty task list and shows a loading error via the {@link Ui}.
* @param filePath path to the data file used for persistence
* Runs the main loop of the application.
* Continuously reads user commands, parses them into {@link Command} objects,
* executes them against the {@link TaskList}, and persists changes.
* Terminates when an exit command is issued.
* Domain-specific checked exception used to signal user-facing errors
* (e.g., parse errors, invalid indices, malformed dates) within the Toki app.
* Responsible for displaying messages, prompts, and errors to the user,
* and reading input lines from the console.
* Shows the welcome message for the application.
show("What can I do for you?");
show("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Shows that an error has occurred, with respective error message.
* @param s Error message that will be displayed
show("Oh no! We detected an error.");
System.out.println("(warn) Could not load saved data. Starting with an empty list.");
* Concrete subclasses implement {@code execute(...)} to perform actions against the
* {@link toki.task.TaskList} and produce output via {@link toki.Ui}. Commands may throw
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
* @throws TokiException if the command cannot be executed due to user error
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException;
* Adds a new {@link toki.task.Deadline} to the list.
* Creates a {@code DeadlineCommand} with description, and date due by.
* @param by LocalDate that the deadline is due by
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
* @throws TokiException if the command cannot be executed due to user error
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException {
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Deletes a task at the specified 1-based index from the current list.
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
* @throws TokiException if the command cannot be executed due to user error
@Override public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException {
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");

public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException {

ui.show("There are no matching tasks in your list.");
* Displays all tasks in the current {@link toki.task.TaskList}.
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.show("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks the task at the specified 1-based index as done.
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
* @throws TokiException if the command cannot be executed due to user error
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException {
ui.show("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Adds a new {@link toki.task.Todo} to the list.
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
* @throws TokiException if the command cannot be executed due to user error
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException {
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Marks the task at the specified 1-based index as not done.
* @param tasks   the task list to mutate/query
* @param ui      the UI for showing messages
* @param storage the storage used to persist changes when necessary
* @throws TokiException if the command cannot be executed due to user error
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws TokiException {
ui.show("Nice! I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* A task that must be completed by a specific date/time.
* Creates a {@code Deadline} with description, and date due by.
* @param by LocalDate that the deadline is due by
* A task that occurs within a time window.
* Creates a {@code Event} with description, start date and end date of the event.
* @param from LocalDate that the event starts from
* @param to LocalDate that the event ends on
public Event(String description, LocalDate from, LocalDate to) {
* Abstract base type for a task.
* Encapsulates common state such as description and completion status,
* and provides APIs used by concrete task types ({@link Todo}, {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}).
* Mutable collection of {@link Task} objects with convenience operations.
* Provides add, remove, get, size, and listing utilities used by commands,
* and acts as the in-memory model for the app session.
//contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list
private final List<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Creates a {@code TaskList} initialized with the given tasks.
* @param loaded list of tasks to populate this task list with
* Returns the number of tasks currently stored.
* @return the size of this task list
* Returns the task at the given zero-based index.
* @param i zero-based index of the task
* @return the task at the specified index
* Adds a new task to the list.
* Finds tasks with keyword on their description.
* @param keyword the keyword to find among the description
* Deletes and returns the task at the given one-based index.
* @param idx1 one-based index of the task (1 = first task)
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is invalid
* Marks the task at the given one-based index as done.
* @param idx1 one-based index of the task
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is invalid
* Marks the task at the given one-based index as not done.
* @param idx1 one-based index of the task
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is invalid
* Returns a defensive copy of the tasks as a list.
* Modifications to the returned list will not affect the task list.
* @return a new {@code List} containing all tasks
* A task with only a textual description and no date/time component.
assertEquals(1, tasks.size(), "size should be 1 after executing TodoCommand");
assertTrue(tasks.get(0) instanceof Todo, "first task should be a Todo");
// Assert: storage.save(...) was called with a snapshot reflecting the new item
assertEquals(1, storage.lastSaved.size(), "saved list should have one task");
// Assert: UI printed the three expected lines (allowing for your formatting)
assertEquals("Got it. I've added this task:", ui.lines.get(0));
assertTrue(ui.lines.get(2).contains("Now you have 1 tasks"), "count line should reflect size");
